intro: Hirtella burchellii, commonly known as the smooth-leaved hirtella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually covered in fine, short hairs, giving it a slightly rough texture. Hirtella burchellii is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
